column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Ken Jackson'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}
column3: p. 716</ref><ref name=TL>{{webcite|author=[[Pieter Collier]]|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/collecting/seenonebay/object17/description.htm|articlename=JRR Tolkien 2 signed letters 1968 Handwritten & Typed|dated=|website=TL|accessed=30 March 2014}}</ref>
column4: that was biology master at New College School.

column2: concerning permission to name his house "[[Bag End]]". Tolkien comments that he did not invent the name; Bag End was the local name for the house of his Aunt [[Jane Neave]].<ref name=CG/>

column1: *'''Publication:''' A small excerpt was published by [[Colin Duriez]] in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment]]''

column2: Thank you for your kind letter. It may interest you to know that (however unfair it may seem) it is impossible to patent mere names
column3: so that you have no obligation to ask my permission
column4: though I appreciate your courtesy.  In the case of Bag-End
column6:
it was in fact the local name of a house an aunt of mine lived in in Worcestershire: an old tumbledown manor house at the end of an untidy lane that led nowhere else.

Yours sincerely
